content: & yarn thickness this is approximately two full repeats plus a partial third repeat through the first garter section with 42g of yarn left over but this may vary based on your yarn and personal gauge unsure weigh your yarn and estimate 8g of yarn per row to determine how many additional row you can work make sure to save at least 12g of yarn for the bind off ©knittymelissa melissa beyer 2022 fundamental shawl - 6 do not copy sell or distribute without permission bind off make sure to bind off loosely so that the edge of your shawl has enough stretch some people also go up a needle size when binding off k2 place both resulting sts back on left needle make sure to slip them back purlwise so you don t change their orientation k2tog-tbl place resulting st back onto left needle repeated to the end of the row break yarn and pull end through remaining st on right needle weave in ends block if desired and wear a note on blocking to block soak shawl in tepid water with a little wool wash such as eucalan or soak wash gently squeeze out as much water as you can do not twist or wring lay the shawl on a towel then roll up the towel with the shawl inside and squeeze i walk on it to remove excess water lay shawl flat to dry smoothing or pinning into shape if necessary alternately lay your shawl flat and spray with a water bottle in the areas that need a little shaping such as the cast on or bind off edges be gentle aggressive blocking isn t necessary unless you want to really open up the lace and/or stretch the shawl but that will reduce the squish factor let dry then wear your new shawl if your shawl ever needs to be washed just repeat the blocking instructions the wool wash will clean the shawl and then it will need to be reshaped by blocking until dry yarn is premier yarns mill ends ©knittymelissa melissa beyer 2022 fundamental shawl - 7 do not copy sell or distribute without permission
